meanings.definition: The part of a shore between high-water and low-water marks.
meanings.sent1: The foreshores are where the waves reach during high tide.
meanings.sent2: We walked along the foreshores, collecting seashells.
meanings.sent3: The crabs on the foreshores were having a beach party.
meanings.sent4: The foreshores whispered secrets to the rolling waves.
meanings.sent5: The foreshores gleamed under the setting sun, painting the sand golden.

meanings.sent1: The cliffs foreshores the calm bay, protecting it from strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The lush forest foreshores the peaceful meadow.
meanings.sent3: The friendly dog loves to foreshores the little kitten during playtime.
meanings.sent4: Her guidance foreshores him through the challenges of life.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse foreshores the ships, guiding them safely to the harbor.
